author: Ankit Banerjee
title: Jasprit Bumrah BREAKS Silence on Captain Hardik Pandya-Mumbai Indians DOWNFALL, Rohit Sharma in IPL
text:
/ .verified-article img {display:inline-block;margin-right:5px;} @media screen and (max-width:766px){.common-all-content .verified-article img {width:25px!important;}} span.verified-article {background: #3aa84f1f;border-radius: 15px; padding-right: 10px;color: #3aa84f;display: inline-block;margin-bottom: 10px;} / virified logo / Jasprit Bumrah celebrates after dismissing Sunil Narine on Saturday. Mumbai: The Indian Premier League 2024 was a nightmarish season for captain Hardik Pandya as he got booed around stadiums in India and the results were also not coming his way. Months after the IPL, MIâ€™s premier pacer Jasprit Bumrah has broken silence on the matter. In an interaction with The Indian Express, Bumrah explained the emotions of fans in India and that it is extremely difficult for a player to deal with it.
â€œWe understand (that) we live in a country where emotion is really the talking point. Itâ€™s an emotion-driven country. We understand that fans do get emotional, and players are also emotional,â€ Bumrah began.
â€œIt does affect that youâ€™re an India player, and youâ€™re playing in India, and your own fans are speaking that about you. But it is the way it is. Youâ€™ve got to take it on your chin. How can you go out there and stop people?
â€œIf you start focussing on yourself, you try to shut that door,â€ said Bumrah.
Hardik turned things around after a horrendous IPL at the 2024 T20 World Cup where he bowled the final over in the summit clash and took India over the line. Times changed for Hardik and fans would be hoping that the Indian all-rounder keeps coming up with good performances in the upcoming season.

author: Scheme=Aglsterms Aglsagent; Corporatename=Commonwealth; Department; Address=Russell Offices; Russell; ACT; Contact=
title: Honouring a half-century of service | Defence
text: 29 December 2023 For Warrant Officer Class Two (WO2) William 'Bob' Parsons, a journey that began fresh out of high school on June 13, 1973, is about to conclude with a remarkable half-century of service to the Australian Army. WO2 Parsons' commitment to Defence was recognised on November 19 with a third Federation Star, along with a seventh clasp on his Defence Long Service Medal. Commander 2nd (Australian) Division Major General David Thomae presented the awards in a ceremony that coincided with the end of Exercise Rhoden Strike. WO2 Parsons proudly shared his memories with the assembled friends and family members. â€œI passed my Centurion drivers' course, allowing me to drive 52 tons of main battle tank before I was allowed to apply for a civilian learner's permit to drive my dad's Morris 1000 on Victorian roads,â€ he said. â€œI think that's a bit of an achievement.â€ The presence of WO2 Parsons' family at the ceremony â€“ including his wife Kerry, who he thanked for the 'team effort', and his son, also WO2 Robert Parsons, who serves in the Royal Australian Armoured Corps, underscored the familial ties that have supported his journey. Currently serving as a training development officer for Melbourne University Regiment at Anglesea Barracks in Hobart, WO2 Parsons continues to impart the lessons he has learned from his extensive career, highlighting the importance of self-discipline, taking care of soldiers, and the crucial role played by junior non-commissioned officers in Army's chain of command. Throughout his career, WO2 Parsons has gained many qualifications across armoured vehicles and has completed numerous overseas training stints. When asked for advice from young soldiers, he emphasises the value of persistence. â€œStick with it. You'll have a lot of opportunities and experiences the Army offers you, as well as the camaraderie you'll experience along the way,â€ he said. To those considering a career in Defence, WO2 Parsons said: â€œGive it a go ... the opportunities provided to you will be lifelong experiences that you'll be able to look back on". Upon retirement, he plans to continue travelling with Kerry, work on his golf handicap and spend more time with family. He also expressed a keen interest in giving back to the Hobart community, seeking local volunteer opportunities where he can continue to make a positive impact.

author: David Lea
title: Fire set outside Oakville grocery store
text:
Halton police are looking for three suspects following an alleged act of arson outside an Oakville grocery store on Wednesday, April 24.
At around 2 a.m., three people attended the Whole Foods Market at 301 Cornwall Rd. and set fire to material inside an industrial-sized recycling bin outside the store, said Const. Jeff Dillon, Halton Regional Police Service media officer.
The fire reportedly spread to adjacent bins; however, the Oakville Fire Department was called to the scene and extinguished the blaze before it could spread any further.
ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW Police said eight to 10 recycling bins were damaged by the flames, with the damage costs estimated at around $800.
The suspects could only be described as two males and one female, all of whom wore dark clothing.
Anyone with information relevant to this investigation is asked to contact Halton police at 905-825-4777 .
Tips can also be submitted anonymously to Crime Stoppers at 1-800-222-TIPS (8477) or through the web at www.haltoncrimestoppers.ca .

author: Amaya LarraÃ±eta
title: 2023, el aÃ±o mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido de nuestras vidas: la temperatura global no deja de subir e intensifica los fenÃ³menos extremos
text: Enero fue el tercer primer mes del aÃ±o mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido desde que hay registros. Febrero, el segundo mÃ¡s caluroso de la historia, marzo igual, abril estuvo ahÃ­ ahÃ­, fue el cuarto mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido de los abriles. Sin embargo, todos l [os meses siguientes (mayo, junio, julio, agosto, septiembre, octubre y noviembre) han alcanzado globalmente temperaturas tan altas que se han convertido en los meses mÃ¡s cÃ¡lidos desde que hay registros, segÃºn ha venido informando ](https://admin.20minutos.es/content/new#) [Copernicus](https://climate.copernicus.eu/press-releases), el Programa de ObservaciÃ³n de la Tierra de la UniÃ³n Europea. A falta del dato oficial de diciembre, los cientÃ­ficos creen que lejos de toda duda el aÃ±o 2023 estÃ¡ a punto de convertirse en el mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido de la historia reciente. "Normalmente se suele esperar a cerrar el mes de diciembre para hacer balance de todos los datos, aunque es cierto que con la informaciÃ³n que tenemos podemos afirmar que, efectivamente, es altamente probable que se consolide como el aÃ±o mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido desde que hay registros", explica a 20minutos Mar GÃ³mez, doctora en FÃ­sicas y jefa de MeteorologÃ­a en [eltiempo.es](https://www.eltiempo.es/). ðŸ§µðŸ—“ï¸El aÃ±o 2023 ha sido extremadamente cÃ¡lido y muy seco en EspaÃ±a.â€” AEMET (@AEMET_Esp) En este hilo hacemos un balance de lo mÃ¡s destacado del aÃ±o en lo que al tiempo y el clima se refiere. ðŸ‘‡ [December 29, 2023] GÃ³mez pone de ejemplo las temperaturas mensuales del Ãºltimo registro oficial, el de noviembre de 2023, que fue el mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido "con una temperatura media del aire en superficie de 14,22Â°C, lo que supone 0,85Â°C por encima de la media de 1991-2020 para ese mes". Lo mismo sucediÃ³ un mes antes, y con una anomalÃ­a similar. Como en junio, julio, agosto o septiembre. "Con estos datos, no es sorprendente que 2023 vaya a ostentar el primer puesto como aÃ±o mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido", dice. La directora adjunta del Servicio de Cambio ClimÃ¡tico de Copernicus, [Samantha Burgess](https://www.europapress.es/sociedad/noticia-copernicus-afirma-bastante-certeza-2023-sera-ano-mas-calido-fecha-20231108035948.html), fue quien anticipÃ³ que, [ "con bastante certeza", 2023 serÃ­a el aÃ±o mÃ¡s cÃ¡lido hasta la fecha](), con una temperatura que estÃ¡ 1,43ÂºC por encima de la era preindustrial. AsÃ­ pues, el umbral climÃ¡tico de [1,5ÂºC sobre el nivel preindustrial ](https://www.ipcc.ch/site/assets/uploads/sites/2/2019/09/SR15_Summary_Volume_spanish.pdf)fijado en el Acuerdo de ParÃ­s de 2015 como mÃ¡ximo a evitar estarÃ­a a punto de ser rebasado. Los efectos del incremento de las temperaturas a nivel global ya se estÃ¡n sintiendo. Los fenÃ³menos meteorolÃ³gicos extremos se estÃ¡n intensificando y exacerbando. "Las olas de calor son mÃ¡s intensas y severas y se prevÃ© que continÃºe asÃ­ e incluso sean mÃ¡s largas, los huracanes serÃ¡n de mayor categorÃ­a y los fenÃ³menos asociados a sequÃ­as o inundaciones se acentuaran entre otras muchas cosas. ContinuarÃ¡ el retroceso de glaciares y el derretimiento de las regiones polares", explica la meteorÃ³loga Mar GÃ³mez. El calentamiento global es fruto de los efectos combinados del cambio climÃ¡tico y del fenÃ³meno de [El NiÃ±o](https://www.20minutos.es/cinemania/minuteca/el-nino/), que este aÃ±o se ha sumado a esta difÃ­cil situaciÃ³n. SegÃºn GÃ³mez, "una serie de olas de calor mortales y temperaturas rÃ©cord notables han afectado a varios continentes este aÃ±o, mientras que el calor del ocÃ©ano sin precedentes cubriÃ³ gran parte del mundo". Ya en verano el clima extremo afectÃ³ a muchos millones de personas, y los responsables de Copernicus seÃ±alaron que, lamentablemente, "la dura realidad del cambio climÃ¡tico" hace que la necesidad de reducir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero sea mÃ¡s urgente que nunca. "La acciÃ³n climÃ¡tica no es un lujo sino una obligaciÃ³n", advirtieron. Mar GÃ³mez tambiÃ©n defiende que debemos preocuparnos y tomar medidas "urgentes" sobre todo a nivel gubernamental. "Hay que eliminar el uso de combustibles fÃ³siles y cambiar nuestro estilo de vida, que pasa por un cambio en la energÃ­a (a renovables), en la forma de consumir, en el transporte...". SequÃ­a pertinaz y muy costosa Mientras tanto, en EspaÃ±a la sequÃ­a sigue instalada y para quedarse. Las reservas de agua para consumo siguen por debajo del nivel del aÃ±o pasado (36,6%), y lejos del nivel medio de la Ãºltima dÃ©cada (48,9%). Las cuencas que menos agua almacenan son la del Guadalete-Barbate (14,5%), las cuencas internas de CataluÃ±a (17,1%), la del Segura (18,8%) y Guadalquivir (19,1%). Es mÃ¡s, la sequÃ­a en EspaÃ±a se situÃ³ en 2023 entre los diez desastres naturales ocasionados por el cambio climÃ¡tico mas costosos, dentro de una clasificaciÃ³n mundial de 20 eventos entre ciclones, inundaciones e incendios. En concreto, ocupa el noveno lugar y [costÃ³ a cada espaÃ±ol 45,5 euros, lo que eleva el coste total a mÃ¡s de 2.100 millones. ](https://www.20minutos.es/noticia/5201271/0/sequia-espana-noveno-desastre-climatico-mas-caro-per-capita-2023-45-5-espanol/) El Ãºltimo Consejo de Ministros del aÃ±o, precisamente, aprobÃ³ este miÃ©rcoles [facultar a las confederaciones hidrogrÃ¡ficas para que reduzcan el suministro de agua](https://www.20minutos.es/noticia/5204325/0/gobierno-autoriza-las-confederaciones-hidrograficas-reducir-suministro-agua-epoca-sequia/) para la "justa y racional distribuciÃ³n de los recursos" en periodos de sequÃ­a.

author: VNExplorer
title: Trans teen who planned mass school, church shootings and wrote chilling manifesto sentenced to 6 years
text:
A transgender Colorado teenager who admitted to plotting mass shootings targeting at least three schools â€” and who had penned a chilling manifesto praising infamous killers â€” has been sentenced to six years in prison.
Lilly Whitworth, 19, born William, learned her fate in an Elbert County courtroom Tuesday. She was given credit of 306 days for time served from the time of her arrest in March 2023.
Given Whitworthâ€™s transgender status, it was not immediately clear whether she would be sent to a womenâ€™s prison or a menâ€™s facility.
A spokesperson for the 18th Judicial Districtâ€™s Attorneyâ€™s Office, which prosecuted the case, told The Post Wednesday that it is not involved in determining a defendantâ€™s place of incarceration.
The Post reached out to the Colorado Department of Corrections (DOC) for comment.
As of Wednesday afternoon, Whitworth was not listed as a DOC inmate in the departmentâ€™s online database.
6
Lilly Whitworth, 19, a transgender woman from Colorado, has been sentenced to six years in prison for plotting school shootings last year. Elbert County Sheriff
6
Whitworth has admitted to planning to carry out a mass shooting at Timberview Middle School, which she had previously attended. Timberview Middle School / Facebook
Whitworth was arrested after her family made a collective decision to hold her â€œaccountable for her actions,â€ the teenâ€™s mother, Melissa Whitworth-Mathes, told The Post last year.
Whitworthâ€™s sister called the police on March 31, telling a dispatcher that the teen was punching holes in the wall and had threatened to shoot up a school.
Police discovered journals written by Whitworth, which included a list of firearms and instructions for how to 3D print them, information on bomb-making and a list of people to be killed, according to an affidavit obtained by The Post.
Whitworth admitted to an officer that she planned to carry out a mass shooting at Timberview Middle School in the Colorado Springs area, which she had previously attended, for â€œno specific reason.â€
Other potential targets mentioned in her notebooks or in text messages included Prairie Hills Elementary and Pine Creek High School, along with churches and government buildings.
6
Whitworth second from the left, was arrested in March 2023 after her family called the police.
Cops discovered floor plans of schools in Whitworthâ€™s papers and on a dry-erase board.
Also recovered was a four-page manifesto which contained words of praise for serial killer Ed Kemper and Sandy Hook shooter Adam Lanza.
When asked how close Whitworth had come to carrying out a mass shooting, she was quoted as telling police that she was â€œabout a third of the way from doing it.â€
Whitworth was initially charged with attempted murder, criminal mischief and menacing, but in November 2023 she pleaded guilty to a single count of second-degree assault.
The rest of the charges against Whitworth were dropped as part of the plea deal.
The teenâ€™s defense lawyers argued that she should be spared prison time, and instead be given probation and sent to a live-in community-corrections program to help her deal with her purported mental health issues, which they claimed had driven her to plan mass shootings, KKTV reported.
6
Whitworth was quoted as telling an officer that she wanted to attack her former school for â€œno specific reason.â€ Timberview Middle School / Facebook
6
Police found among Whitworthâ€™s writings references to a plan to shoot up Pine Creek High School. Pine Creek High School / Facebook
â€œIâ€™m truly sorry,â€ Whitworth said in court earlier this month. â€œI thank God I got out. You get addicted to the pain, depression and isolation.â€
â€œI was in too deep, way too deep,â€ she added. â€œThe choices Iâ€™ve made, I regret.â€
Judge Theresa Slade rejected the defense attorneysâ€™ pleas for leniency and ruled that a prison sentence was the only way to â€œensure a sense of securityâ€ in the community, according to reporting by the Denver Gazette.
â€œThis had a pretty big impact on the community,â€ she said of Whitworthâ€™s murderous plans. â€œPeople were hurt, people were scared.â€
6
Mom Melissa Whitworth-Mathes, second from left, with Lilly (center).
Prosecutor Eva Wilson, who argued for a 10-year prison sentence for Whitworth, citing the detailed plans she had laid out in her journals to carry out massacres, welcomed the judgeâ€™s ruling.
â€œI think the Department of Corrections sentence is absolutely supported by all the evidence, all the planning and the impact on the victims,â€ Wilson said after the sentencing. â€œI think anything less â€¦ would just not be appropriate, considering the magnitude of the planning and the efforts made.â€
Eric Ross, media relations director for the 18th Judicial District Attorneyâ€™s Office, told The Post that while it was not â€œthe exact sentenceâ€ that prosecutors were looking for, they are grateful that the judge denied probation for Whitworth.
â€œWe are still satisfied and respect the judgeâ€™s decision,â€ he said.

author: Notimerica
title: Los hutÃ­es garantizan el paso seguro de barcos rusos y chinos por el mar Rojo
text: MADRID, 19 Ene. (EUROPA PRESS) - La insurgencia hutÃ­ de Yemen ha garantizado que no atacarÃ¡ barcos comerciales de China o de Rusia durante sus operaciones en el mar Rojo y reiterado que el objetivo principal de sus ataques es el de "incrementar el coste de la guerra para Israel" y que detenga asÃ­ "la carnicerÃ­a que estÃ¡ perpetrando en la Franja de Gaza". El miembro del politburÃ³ del movimiento AnsarolÃ¡, Mohamed al Buheite, ha llegado incluso a ofrecer "paso seguro" a los barcos de ambos paÃ­ses "porque la libre navegaciÃ³n juega un papel muy destacado en el desarrollo de Yemen", ha hecho saber en una entrevista al diario ruso 'Izvestia'. Sin embargo, y como ya han avisado en otras ocasiones sus camaradas, "los barcos israelÃ­es o aquellos que estÃ©n vinculados a Israel de alguna forma" no tendrÃ¡n "ni la mÃ¡s mÃ­nima oportunidad de navegar a travÃ©s del mar Rojo". "Los ataques contra ellos van a continuar", ha aÃ±adido. En sus comentarios al medio, el responsable hutÃ­ ha restado importancia a la reciente designaciÃ³n del grupo como organizaciÃ³n terrorista por parte de Estados Unidos, una decisiÃ³n que no es mÃ¡s que "otra confirmaciÃ³n de la indefensiÃ³n y la insolvencia" de Washington, que "solo demuestra la escasa autoridad que le queda ya a Occidente". Es mÃ¡s, el responsable hutÃ­ ha defendido que cualquier expansiÃ³n de las operaciones militares de Estados Unidos y Reino Unido solo redundarÃ¡ en beneficio de la causa hutÃ­. "Cualquier enfrentamiento directo contra ambos paÃ­ses es una mejor opciÃ³n que la guerra que han librado por terceros desde hace una dÃ©cada en este paÃ­s", ha declarado Al Buheite sobre el respaldo concedido por Arabia SaudÃ­ al Gobierno yemenÃ­ frente a los rebeldes hutÃ­es a lo largo de una dÃ©cada de guerra civil en Yemen. "En esta guerra ya hemos perdido mucho mÃ¡s de lo que perderÃ­amos en un nuevo conflicto. Los bombardeos de la coaliciÃ³n occidental contra nuestro paÃ­s solo servirÃ­an para unirnos", ha declarado el portavoz hutÃ­ antes de asegurar que "la locura y la idiotez exhibidas por Estados Unidos y Reino Unido han terminado por jugar en su contra: ahora sus barcos se quedarÃ¡n sin usar una de las principales arterias comerciales del mundo". Para ir terminando, Al Buheiti ha indicado que los hutÃ­es no tienen estrategia alguna en este conflicto mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de la que marque "el Todopoderoso". "Estamos adoptando todas nuestras decisiones sin pensar en cÃ¡lculos materiales, polÃ­ticos, militares o econÃ³micos. Estamos guiados por el mensaje de Dios. Nuestra lucha es una de autodefensa, guiados por los estÃ¡ndares Ã©ticos y morales de nuestra religiÃ³n". El portavoz hutÃ­, por Ãºltimo, ha desmentido que IrÃ¡n -- su gran aliado en la guerra civil -- estÃ© detrÃ¡s de sus operaciones al aducir que "la guerra estÃ¡ en Gaza, no en TeherÃ¡n ni cualquier otro sitio" y acusar a Occidente de "distorsionar la realidad para desviar la atenciÃ³n de los bombardeos contra el enclave palestino". "El mundo", ha rematado, "tiene solo dos opciones: o une fuerzas con Yemen para poner fin a la guerra en Gaza o se queda del lado de Estados Unidos y Reino Unido a la hora de encubrir los crÃ­menes del rÃ©gimen israelÃ­. Esto es lo importante, no de donde proceden nuestras armas, algo que no guarda interÃ©s para nadie".

author: Michael Major
title: Close To Monday Tap DJ Slevin For Darkwave Electro Remix of 'Religion'
text: DJ Slevin creates a musical experience that defies stereotypes while introducing a unique sound to Close To Mondayâ€™s musical legacy. POPULAR Emerging indie electronic duo Close To Monday, made up of producer Alexander and singer/songwriter Ann, has cultivated a devoted fanbase with a distinctive sound compared to the likes of CHVRCHES and Boy Harsher, while still establishing a musical identity uniquely theirs. They are still riding high off their previous single â€œLieâ€, praised by the likes of CULTR for its â€œcinematic feelâ€ and Electro Zombies for its â€œharmonious and catchyâ€energy. Continuing their monthly series of singles, Close To Monday are thrilled to release a tantalizing darkwave electro remix, courtesy of DJ Slevin, to their single â€œReligionâ€ - out now. DJ Slevin creates a musical experience that defies stereotypes while introducing a unique sound to Close To Mondayâ€™s musical legacy. The combination of swirling synthesizers, driving bass, and thumping rhythm create an emotional journey, allowing listeners to immerse themselves into this world of freedom and choice as Close To Monday sing â€œdo what you want, with no distractionâ€¦ itâ€™s your religion.â€ The track, as if unveiling a vault of thoughts, compels the heart to beat along to its hypnotic, underground grooves. By blending different elements of darkwave, house and techno, DJ Slevin shows off the remix's versatility while also proving it as a dynamic piece of art that doesn't stick to one genre. Since their start, Close To Monday has already achieved impressive milestones, securing top 3 placements in the Dutch Alternative Charts. Additionally, their music videos for songs such as â€œGunsâ€ have won at international film festivals in London, Rome, and Paris. Close to Monday music is a guide for people who are on a journey, exploring themselves and the surrounding world. Each of the band's tracks communicate a 'photo of feelings' â€“ a ready-made image, a situation reflecting their perception of things happening in the world and inside themselves, emotional experiences that are familiar to everyone.â€™ Videos TICKET CENTRAL
